ngiemboon: Á laa na ngùʼu láʼ mbɔ́ɔntè yétá páʼ Silẅísè laa fùɔ pʉ̀a Pɛ́ɛsè, e Ssé gɔɔn nò mbwó Ndanîɛ gẅie mé lɔ́ɔn ńgíŋe ńtóŋo yé lê Mbɛleshÿaza. Yɔɔn shwóŋè nò nénʉ́ lɔ́ɔn ńdaʼte nò na máa ncù gẅie mé ge lÿɔ́ʼ. À la leen ńjúʼu yɔɔn shwóŋè, e Ssé leen nyɛ́ʼ nÿɔ́g mé, á zsé mmó gie yɔɔn shwóŋè lɔgɔ ńgɔɔn.
en: In the third year of King Cyrus of Persia,   a message was revealed to Daniel, who was named Belteshazzar.  # 10:1 Dn 1:7 The message was true and was about a great conflict. He understood the message and had understanding of the vision.  # 10:1 Dn 1:17; 2:21

ngiemboon: «Á laa na mɛ̌ melyɛ̌ʼ ŋwɛ́, mèŋ Ndanîɛ, n dʉa legwé lʉa na mengàba láʼ méntá.
en: In those days I, Daniel, was mourning for three full weeks.

ngiemboon: N te tsẅe ḿpfɛ́ɛ tsɔ̌ mbòŋo mmó léjÿó wɔ́, n te pfɛ́ mbàb wɔ́, ńké te nú melùʼ wɔ́, ńké te fɔ́ɔn laméndɔ̀ɔn wɔ́ tà mɛ̌ mengàba láʼ méntá láʼ ńtɔ́g.
en: I didn’t eat any rich food,   no meat or wine entered my mouth, and I didn’t put any oil on my body until the three weeks were over.

ngiemboon: Á laa na lyɛʼɛ́ láʼ mbɔ́ɔntè ntsɔ̀b lekùɔ né móm mbʉ́a, á na ndùŋmvfò saŋ, n gwɔ́ ngʉ̀ŋe máamáa mí gẅie mé tóŋo lê Tíigele.
en: On the twenty-fourth day of the first month,   as I was standing on the bank of the great river,  # 10:4 Ezk 1:3; Dn 8:2 the Tigris,

ngiemboon: M bʉʼʉ nÿɔ́g mɔ́ɔn ńgyá tsɔ̌ nyìŋ á maʼ nzsǒ gie mé la lɔgɔ tʉ̀nzẅìŋ sìsyè ḿbáʼ, ḿbiŋ ńjÿɔ́g kwɔb gẅie mé la lɔgɔ tʉ̌ ngɔ̂ɔ gie á fóo Ufaaze ńnyɛte, á zẅɛ̌ʼ yé.
en: I looked up, and there was a man dressed in linen,   with a belt of gold  # 10:5 Rv 1:13; 15:6 from Uphaz  # 10:5 Some Hb mss read Ophir,# 10:5 Jr 10:9 around his waist.

ngiemboon: Mbùm ye laa páʼ tsɔ̌ tʉ̀nzẅìŋ tóon, eshÿó wé ŋwʉŋe páʼ nně mbʉ̀ŋ, menÿɔ́g mé gwɔ́ páʼ lʉ́me mmɔ̌g, mbwó mé pâ mekwò mé ŋwʉŋe páʼ tʉ̌ ŋwʉ̀ gie mé kẅilé ncÿǒ mǒ, á ne ńgɔɔn nò, ngyè ye gwɔ́ pɔ́ páʼ mengyè pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn pie é ne ńzoŋo nò.
en: His body was like beryl,   his face like the brilliance of lightning, his eyes like flaming torches,  # 10:6 Rv 1:14; 2:18; 19:12 his arms and feet like the gleam of polished bronze, and the sound of his words like the sound of a multitude.  # 10:6 Rv 19:6

ngiemboon: Mèŋ Ndanîɛ, n gyá yɛ̌ mmó pɔ́ gíle mèŋ. Epʉ̀a pie peg lâ pɔ̌ laa nùɔ la te gyá. Táʼ, mbà pɔ́ la pú ńcÿɔʼ tà ńkÿo ńgʉa ńdyeen.
en: Only I, Daniel, saw the vision.   The men who were with me did not see it,  # 10:7 Ac 9:7 but a great terror fell on them,  # 10:7 Ezk 12:18 and they ran and hid.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ gíle mèŋ zɔ la gyá yɔɔn nkʉ̀ʼʉ mmó tsɛ̀ɛ njÿòon. Metʉ̀ mɔ́ɔn mag, eshÿó wɔ́ɔn kwé, ḿbiŋ ńŋúʼte, atsɔ́ lagá tʉ̀ té gíŋ ńgwɔ́ na mèŋ wɔ́.
en: I was left alone, looking at this great vision.   No strength was left in me; my face grew deathly pale,  # 10:8 Lit my splendor was turned on me to ruin,# 10:8 Dn 7:28; 8:27; Hab 3:16 and I was powerless.

ngiemboon: N júʼ ngyè ye, páʼ n da júʼ ngyè ŋwɛ́ la, máamáa cÿɔʼ gwoon wɔ́ɔn tà n gwe, legye sɔ́ɔn pyé.
en: I heard the words he said, and when I heard them I fell into a deep sleep,  ,# 10:9 Gn 15:12; Jb 4:13; Dn 8:18 with my face to the ground.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ fʉʼó, n júʼ atsɔ́ pwó nyìŋ kíbe wɔ́ɔn, ḿbʉʼʉ wɔ́ɔn, n kẅíʼte ssé, mekẅiʼté mɔ́ɔn pâ mbwó mɔ́ɔn mie e sɔbɔ́ ssé, é pú ne ḿvɛɛ.
en: Suddenly, a hand touched me and set me shaking on my hands and knees.

ngiemboon: Á leen ńké ńgɔɔn né mèŋ ngie: “Ndanîɛ, gù gẅie Ssé kwoŋo gú, kag tʉ̀ léjúʼ menò mie n ge gɔɔn né gù. Lu ssé ńtyé tyé á jʉʼ gie ɔɔ wó lɛ, á nue mé tumó wɔ́ɔn né gù fʉ̀ʼɔɔn.” N da leen ńjúʼ púʼu, ńdu ssé ńtyé tyé ńne ḿvɛɛ.
en: He said to me, “Daniel, you are a man treasured by God.  ,# 10:11 Dn 9:23; 10:19 Understand the words that I’m saying to you. Stand on your feet,  # 10:11 Ezk 2:2; Dn 8:18 for I have now been sent to you.”  # 10:11 Heb 11:14 After he said this to me, I stood trembling.

ngiemboon: Á gɔɔn né mèŋ ngie: “Ndanîɛ, pɔ́ɔn lépɔ́g! Tà fó ndùŋmvfò lyɛ̌ʼ gie ɔ̀ la tsɔ́ɔn lézsé mmó gie á ne ńcʉa ḿbiŋ ésẅíʼi mbùm jù ńnáa ssé mvfò Ssé jù, mé la júʼu sẅíŋtè jú, m bǐŋ ńtó páʼɔɔn lénáa gú piŋé.
en: “Don’t be afraid,   Daniel,” he said to me, “for from the first day that you purposed to understand and to humble yourself before your God,  # 10:12 Dn 9:2–23; 10:2–3 your prayers were heard. I have come because of your prayers.  # 10:12 Ac 10:30–31

ngiemboon: Cÿɔ́ʼ Ssé gẅie à tÿɔ́ʼte láʼa pʉ̀a Pɛ́ɛsè ka lɔg lyɛ̌ʼ ntsɔ̀b wémɔʼɔ́ né móm mbʉ́a ńdÿɔ́ʼɔ wɔ́ɔn, tá Mikayɛɛ gẅie aa tsɔ̌ tàʼ na mecÿɔ́ʼ Ssé pelÿò tó ńkẅéte wɔ́ɔn. Tà fó fʉʼó, mé kúʼte wɔ́ɔn lejʉ́ŋ mefùɔ pʉ̀a Pɛ́ɛsè.
en: But the prince of the kingdom of Persia opposed me for twenty-one days. Then Michael,   one of the chief princes, came to help me after I had been left there with the kings of Persia.  # 10:13 Dn 7:17; 8:21

ngiemboon: N tǒ fʉ̀ʼɔɔn léshwóŋo gú mmó gie á ge gÿo gÿo pʉ̀a pú, á na melyɛ̌ʼ mie é ne ńtóo, á nue n ge gíŋ nyɛ́ʼ nÿɔ́g mú ɔ̀ gyá tsɔ́ menò.”
en: Now I have come to help you understand what will happen to your people in the last days,   for the vision refers to those days.”  # 10:14 Dn 8:26; 12:4,9

ngiemboon: À la gwɔ́ tà ne ńgɔɔn nò né mèŋ, n cʉ́ŋe twó yɔ́ɔn, n te gíŋ ńkuʼu légɔɔn nò wɔ́.
en: While he was saying these words to me, I turned my face toward the ground and was speechless.

ngiemboon: Afʉʼó la, atsɔ̌ nyìŋ tó, ésẅé pɔ́ nyìŋ mesoŋ ńkíbe mekùb ncwò mɔ́ɔn. N deen ńkuʼu léŋáʼ ncwò wɔ́ɔn ńgɔɔn nò pɔ́ sẅé sẅé, n deen ńké ńgɔɔn né nyìŋ gẅie à tyé mvfò mèŋ ngie: “Andè wɔ̀ɔn, cʉ̌a na mmó gie Ssé nyɛɛ wɔ́ɔn n gyá, m bɔ̌g pɔ́g tà lagá metʉ̀ te gíŋ ńgwɔ́ na mèŋ wɔ́.
en: Suddenly one with human likeness   touched my lips.  # 10:16 Is 6:7; Jr 1:9 I opened my mouth and said to the one standing in front of me, “My lord, because of the vision, anguish overwhelms me and I am powerless.  # 10:16 Dn 7:15,28; 8:17,27; 10:8–9

ngiemboon: Mèŋ gẅie e faʼa fàʼ jú, ngwɔ́ n gɔɔn nò né gù Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wɔ̀ɔn lêkɔ́? Á fʉ̀ʼɔɔn gie lagá metʉ̀ té gíŋ ńgwɔ́ na mèŋ wɔ́, n cʉ́ʼʉ ńjúʼu lézẅige wɔ́ lɔɔn.”
en: How can someone like me,   your servant,  # 10:17 Lit Can I, a servant of my lord speak with someone like you, my lord? Now I have no strength, and there is no breath in me.”

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ ŋwɛ́ gẅie à la gwɔ́ pɔ́ páʼ nyìŋ mesoŋ la gíŋ ńkíbe wɔ́ɔn pɔ́ sẅé sẅé, ńgÿo metʉ̀ mɔ́ɔn gíŋ ḿbiŋe.
en: Then the one with a human appearance touched me again and strengthened me.

ngiemboon: Á gɔɔn né mèŋ ngie: “Gù gẅie Ssé kwoŋo gú, pɔ́ɔn légíŋ ḿbɔ́g! Kúʼte mbùm jù ńtʉte! Tʉte!” À la nyé ńgɔɔn gɔɔn, n júʼ páʼ metʉ̀ mɔ́ɔn gíŋe ḿbiŋe. N gɔɔn né yé ngie: “Gɔɔn nò né mèŋ mbà cʉ̀apʉ̀a wɔ̀ɔn, mélàʼmie ɔ̀ gíŋe ńgÿo n tʉte.”
en: He said, “Don’t be afraid,   you who are  # 10:19 Lit afraid, man treasured by God.  # 10:19 Dn 9:23; 10:11 Peace to you; be very strong! ”  # 10:19 Jos 1:6–7,9; Is 35:4

ngiemboon: Á zɛ́te wɔ́ɔn ngie: “Ɔ̀ zsě mmó gie á gÿǒ tá n tóo lejʉ́ŋ gù?” Afʉ́ʼɔɔn la, n ge piŋ nzèm, é gʉa lÿɔ́ʼɔ cÿɔ́ʼ Ssé gẅie à pyɛ́bɛ pʉ̀a Pɛ́ɛsè, afʉ̀ʼ gie n gʉ̌a la, cÿɔ́ʼ Ssé gẅie à pyɛ́bɛ pʉ̀a Ngelékiya zɔ cʉ́ʼ ńtó.
en: He said, “Do you know why I’ve come to you? I must return at once to fight against the prince of Persia, and when I leave, the prince of Greece will come.

ngiemboon: Táʼ, mèŋ shwóŋo gú páʼɔɔn mmó gie á ŋweʼe tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwàʼne nò nénʉ́ jú. É lɔɔn te ndàʼ cÿɔ́ʼ Ssé Mikayɛɛ gẅie ngwɔ́ á kẅéte wɔ́ɔn mɔ́, mbà n te gẅiin tsɔ̌ nyìŋ gẅie ngwɔ́ á kẅéte wɔ́ɔn lélÿɔ́ʼ pʉ̀a pɛ̂ wɔ́.»
en: However, I will tell you what is recorded in the book of truth. (No one has the courage to support me against those princes except Michael,   your prince.
